Entries.default: "Captain, something's been rubbing me the wrong way."
You catch Serafen scowling at you out of the corner of your eye. When you turn to look at him, he snaps back to a neutral expression, standing stiffly, but meeting your gaze with narrow eyes.

"Ahoy, captain! If I can bend your ear a moment, I be aiming to thank you for bringing me aboard."

A furred hand at his belly and one heel out, he bows deeply, drooping ear almost touching the ground.

"Ahoy captain!"

Serafen snaps to salute, a wide smile splashed across his furred face.
"Tell me."
"Rubbing? This better not be about your love life."
"Your problems aren't my concern."

"Right then. Thanks for teaching me my place."

Rage flickers in the base of your skull.

A rapid series of shouts and screams, lashes across backs, flares of pain betwixt your shoulder blades, the tearing of hair, agony as a pointed fingernail is plucked, the cold clawing grasp of sea-spray, your limbs aching, tied to the bowsprit.
"If I'm being honest - and I fucking hate honesty - I'm not certain how I fit with this crew."
"You're not the only odd man out here."
"Why? What's the problem?"
"I'm not sure you fit in either."
"That so? The islands can be a dry and poxy whore for loners and misfits. Easier waters by far with a friend at your back."
"Seems to me you could be showing me a tad more trust. There ain't another among your crew that knows the dangers of the Deadfire like I do."
"What do you mean?"
"Trust must be earned."
"I'll keep that in mind."
"Right. Mayhaps I've not yet earned your trust, but I've found trust be like water. It flows easiest upstream to down."
"I ain't your swabby. I ain't a powder monkey or a cabin boy. And I certainly ain't your fucking slave, savvy?"
"I'll use you how I see fit."

"Thanks, captain."

Serafen studiously inspects his boots.
"Something on your mind?"
"What's the problem?"
[Ignore Serafen.]

"Aye, captain, though since when've you given one bilge rat's ass what be going on in my head?"

Beneath his shaggy moustache, Serafen's lips stretch thin.
[Insight] "I know following me hasn't been easy for you."
"Tell me, Serafen."
"Speak. That's an order."
"Just been pondering on the differences twixt you and Captain Furrante. Never much liked the old bastard, but at least I had reason to trust him."
You regard Serafen's for a few seconds until his eyes lower. When you focus your attention elsewhere, you feel a warm tingle of relief.
"What do you miss about your last ship?"
"Surely, I'm better than Furrante."
"Then go! There's no room on my ship for those who don't want to be here."
"Then happily do I resign my post. I'll be returning to my real crew upon the Gentleman of Leisure."
"You have my leave to go."
"Yes, by all means fuck off, Serafen."
"No, I need you here."
"All due respect, Watcher, fuck you, too."
Serafen salutes ironically with a sardonic smile, and then walks away.
"Too late for that, Watcher. You and me? We ain't nothing no more. Mayhaps we never were."
"I may not've been thick as blood with the Gentleman's crew, but at least the salty bastards treated me with respect."
"I won't be arguing on that, but same as it was with Furrante, it be plain as a Dyrwood farmer that you and me ain't friends, nor never will be neither."
"I want us to be friends."
"I don't need your friendship, just your loyalty."
"Problem be, captain, I've rarely met a more rotten kith than yourself. Gods know that I be no clergyman, but you make what few convictions I hold seem the dedication of a Readceran saint."
"What have I done that's so bad?"
"I'm sorry. I'll try to do better."
"I'll do as I wish. If you can't handle it, you'll make a poor meal for the sharks."
"Takes a right bastard to be leaving a friend to drown in sand."

"You've got that. So long as you don't go slaving up the coasts or razing the homes of the innocent."

He holds your gaze with his.
"I'm glad you're with me."
"You're welcome."
Serafen's fur bristles and eyes widen. His hand twitches beside the weapons at his hip. Then he audibly exhales and forces a grim smirk.
"You be a scourge of a man, cap, but I'll do your bidding... for now."
Entries.female: "You be a right hard lass, cap, but I'll do your bidding... for now."

Entries.default: Serafen bows to you soberly, and then returns to his duties.
"I'd hope so, given you be the one that makes it such."
"I don't expect you to understand, but I do expect you to obey."
"Tell me about the Gentleman of Leisure."
"I don't have time for this."
"Our ship is a family to me, and I consider you a brother, Serafen."
"Heh, methinks me more crazy uncle than brother, but I appreciate your saying it all the same."
"You're a valuable member of my crew."
"I've a gift for you. This trinket be from one of the first ships I hunted. Malnaj would've snatched it had I not found the perfect hiding spot."
"I understand. You're an important part of this crew."
"If you're done complaining, I have other things to do."
"So where did you hide it?"
"Thank you for the gift, Serafen."
"I'll pass on the gift. You keep it."

"Now were I to tell you that, you mightn't want it no more..."

Serafen gives an innocent whistle, while scratching his ass as subtly as one could scratch it.

"Aye, Captain Watcher. Back to duty then."

He frowns and rubs the back of his head.
"Eh? Suit yourself then. But just so you be knowing, it be considered cock-rotten luck to refuse a pirate's gift sincerely given."
"Why did Malnaj treat you so badly?"
"Ha! Just a jest, cap! Nay, I tucked it away in my beard. Didn't wear braids back then, so my hair caught bout everything from feathers to fish bones."
"Malnaj shook me down for plunder after each raid, and I figured out she wouldn't go nowhere near my beard. Said my face were like a xaurip fetish."
"Don't rightly know for sure, cap. Thought at first she wanted me. Lasses be that way sometimes, treating you worse the more they fancy you."

"Given she tried to get me killed twice within our first fortnight together, I thought mayhaps she were in deepest love."

He chuckles quietly.
"Didn't fancy her in the least, but a man has needs, and I figured at the time that she were as wet as any other lass."
"Were you attracted to Malnaj?"
"Love makes people do crazy things."
"On second thought, I don't want to hear about this."

"Figured I'd give her a whisper about what we might get down to in the hold. Her answer were an unequivocal no, made with a sharpness. Might've been the closest I've ever been to death."

He winces and rubs his throat.
"Can't fault you that. Malnaj be one of my least favorite things to speak of."

"As I said, I never rightly figured it out. It weren't that I were orlan, given she were, too. Remaro said she might've been emerald green with envy, but I'll be Wael hisself if I know what of."

He shrugs, his palms up and spread wide.
"So what was the issue?"
"As a shiphunter? Mayhaps. I've certainly outpaced her since if I do say so meself. Mayhaps she saw that coming."
"The Gentleman is only the finest ship among the Pr√≠ncipi, and Captain Furrante our most respected shipmaster. It were two honors and a half to be chosen to join his crew..."

"Don't sell yourself a suole short, cap, nor me neither. I know an opportunity when I board it."

He chuckles.
"Why were you willing to leave that crew to join mine?"
"Good to know."
"I detect a 'but' in there."
"Aye, you ain't wrong. Joining the Gentleman meant leaving the Sorcerer, leaving the only family I've ever known."
"Family?"
"Never knew no kin 'til the Sorcerer. They be my salt family, and to me that be better far than blood."

"And believe you me, I do appreciate meself a good thrust."

He grins.

"You be entirely welcome. Now, if you'll pardon me, I've round about reached my limit for sentiment."

Serafen salutes, grinning broadly, and turns away.
"Don't get too comfortable."
"Wouldn't dream of it, captain."
"Where did you get this?"
"And I think you'll look right spiff in it, too."
"Remaro gifted it to me when I took leave of the Sorcerer. He had this notion I'd make captain meself some day."
"Thank you for the gift."
"Does that mean you don't want to be a captain?"
"You should keep this for when you're a captain."
"You? A captain? That's funny."

"Mayhaps I coveted a captain's quarters when I were a wee swabby, but serving with Furrante, with yourself, seeing what leading a crew takes... well, I reckon it's like marrying - it just ain't for me."

"Pleasure be entirely mine, cap. May it serve you at least half as well as I."

He bows deeply, then salutes and turns away.
"I'd be an at least half-able pirate captain were I so inclined, if for nothing other than my adversaries underestimating me. My friends, too."
"Why not?"

"For firsts, I've got less than an orlan's thimble worth of patience for all the politics, glad-handing, cronyism, and sycophancy that goes 'long with the Consuaglo."

He shakes his head, but then breaks the gesture with a grin and taps the center of his chest.

"But mostly this heart be twice as soft as this belly. Probably as furry, too."

He chuckles.
When your vision clears, Serafen has turned away.
"Hey, they know us down here."
He straightens, chin jutting and taking his lower lip with it.

"Then try harder."

He shakes his head and turns away.
"I know we ain't always seen cod to cock, but serving with you's a welcome change from the Gentleman of Leisure all the same."
"You run a right tight shop, and you ain't no terrible person neither. It be a welcome change from the Gentleman of Leisure."
"I'd seen what there were to be seen upon the Gentleman, learned what ropes were to be learned. Methinks a Watcher after a dead god'll thrust me into a whole new set of eye openings."

"Aye, captain, you ain't farting out your mouth there."

He nods sagely.
"Something you might want to be keeping in mind yourself."
"Maybe she thought you were a threat."
"I think I understand. Half the time I want to throw you off the boat, too."
"You aren't exactly couth. You probably offended her."
"Well thank you kindly for the caution, Captain Watcher. I'll set meself to practicing my breaststroke."

"Aye, that's about how I had it figured, too. My mouth's landed me in straits a time or ten."

He winks with a snicker.
"Just never figured Malnaj as the sensitive sort, savvy?"
"Gah! Desganta!"
"Ahoy yourself, Serafen."
"What are you so happy about?"
"Truth be told, I've not felt so cozy in a crew since my tour on the Sorcerer. With Remaro and the lot. Good times and a half, that."
After a quick trio of blinks, Serafen forces a chuckle.
"By way of expressing my gratitude, I've a tribute to be presenting. It's meant to be worn by a great captain. I think you rightly qualify."
With a slight frown, Serafen stares into your eyes.
"Mayhaps I could captain a boat like yourself. All even-keeled and kindly. But you're a rare sort, aren't you?"
"The captain's wheel demands choices hard and harder, and there's some things I don't much want weighing on my soul when it goes to Ondra."
"Most helms could use a captain with a thimble of self-awareness."
"You have a heart as good as your mouth is foul, Serafen."
"I like when people compliment you, Watcher. Shows they're smart."

"I've always had a way with the lasses."

He winks.

"I wish I could be believing that, captain."

He shakes his head and turns away.

"If this be a jest, captain, it be a shit one. Otherwise..."

He shakes his head sadly.
"Mayhaps you remember veritably selling that lad of Fassina's to the Rauatai?"
"Two words for you cap - Crook. Spur."
"Most everything, cap."
"Need I be reminding you of the wee orlan lass you abducted and then brutally murdered?"
"While I weren't the fondest of Aloth, I suppose I should be mentioning how you marooned that poor prat."
